docs.lead_paragraph: Wisconsin's attorney general on Tuesday filed a lawsuit against the U.S. government, asking a federal judge if the state can drug test some food stamp recipients, a policy supported by Republican Governor Scott Walker, a presidential candidate.

headline.main: Wisconsin Asks Federal Court to Clarify Food Stamp Drug Testing Law
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin Asks Federal Court to Clarify Food Stamp Drug Testing Law

docs.snippet: Wisconsin's attorney general on Tuesday filed a lawsuit against the U.S. government, asking a federal judge if the state can drug test some food stamp recipients, a policy supported by Republican Governor Scott Walker, a presidential candidate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Oklahoma Republican Party on Tuesday removed a Facebook post that compared people who receive food stamps to wild animals after it set off a social-media storm.

headline.main: Oklahoma Republicans Compare Food-Stamp Recipients to Animals
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Republicans Compare Food-Stamp Recipients to Animals

docs.snippet: The Oklahoma Republican Party on Tuesday removed a Facebook post that compared people who receive food stamps to wild animals after it set off a social-media storm.

docs.lead_paragraph: The chairman of the Oklahoma Republican Party apologized Tuesday for a post on the party's Facebook page that said giving people food stamps is akin to feeding animals in national parks, marking the new leader's latest misstep over divisive comments.

headline.main: Oklahoma GOP Post Compared Food-Stamp Recipients to Animals
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma GOP Post Compared Food-Stamp Recipients to Animals

docs.snippet: The chairman of the Oklahoma Republican Party apologized Tuesday for a post on the party's Facebook page that said giving people food stamps is akin to feeding animals in national parks, marking the new leader's latest misstep over divisive comments.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fuel shortages in war-torn Yemen could cause more deaths than the continuing conflict, which rages on three days after the start of a United Nations-brokered humanitarian truce, an international aid agency said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Yemen Fuel Shortages Could Kill More Than 'Bullets or Bombs' as Truce Ignored
headline.print_headline: Yemen Fuel Shortages Could Kill More Than 'Bullets or Bombs' as Truce Ignored

docs.snippet: Fuel shortages in war-torn Yemen could cause more deaths than the continuing conflict, which rages on three days after the start of a United Nations-brokered humanitarian truce, an international aid agency said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stephen Joseph first sued in San Francisco over graffiti. He lost, but the city cleaned up the graffiti. His latest victory is trans fats. He has learned that you can lose in court, but carry the day.

headline.main: When This Man Is Irked, He Might Just File a Suit
headline.print_headline: When This Man Is Irked, He Might Just File a Suit

docs.abstract: Public interest lawyer Stephen L Joseph has filed suit against tech companies Apple, Google, Microsoft and Samsung claiming that their smartphones and other devices encourage people to engage in deadly habit of distracted driving; ban of trans fats that will go into effect in 2018 is mark of how Joseph's sometimes quixotic suits can yield fruit, as he was first to turn issue into legal battle when he successfully sued Kraft Foods in 2003 to eliminate those fats from Oreo cookies.
docs.snippet: Stephen Joseph first sued in San Francisco over graffiti. He lost, but the city cleaned up the graffiti. His latest victory is trans fats. He has learned that you can lose in court, but carry the day.

docs.lead_paragraph: The child stopped walking. Bones in his scans appeared to be mottled and irregular. Could there be a nutritional cure?

headline.main: Why Did Every Touch Cause This 2-Year-Old Pain?

docs.lead_paragraph: Its 3.5 million people are already American citizens, but only statehood can grant them true equality.

headline.main: Statehood Is the Only Antidote for What Ails Puerto Rico

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Puerto Rico Congressional delegate Pedro R Pierluisi contends Puerto Rico's economic woes are being driven by its position of inequality in relationship with United States; argues that while Puerto Rico is claimed by United States, it has fewer voting rights than states and receives fraction of Medicaid, Medicare and other benefits given to states; says only enduring solution for Puerto Rico's financial troubles is statehood and equal treatment.
docs.snippet: Its 3.5 million people are already American citizens, but only statehood can grant them true equality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Simple interventions such as using community workers to promote breast-feeding in villages have helped India improve the health of its women and children and could be good global examples, say aid workers, citing early findings from a U.N.-backed survey.
